docs.snippet: Democrat Hillary Clinton, who is running against Republican Donald Trump in the Nov. 8 presidential election, is expected to announce her running mate as early as Friday....
docs.lead_paragraph: Democrat Hillary Clinton, who is running against Republican Donald Trump in the Nov. 8 presidential election, is expected to announce her running mate as early as Friday.

headline.main: Factbox: Clinton to Name Running Mate as Early as Friday
headline.print_headline: Factbox: Clinton to Name Running Mate as Early as Friday

docs.snippet: For many black Republicans, speeches have veered toward moralizing on race, an off-putting posture given Donald J. Trump’s unpopularity with minority voters....
docs.lead_paragraph: For many black Republicans, speeches have veered toward moralizing on race, an off-putting posture given Donald J. Trump’s unpopularity with minority voters.
docs.abstract: Black Republicans express alarm over moralizing and polarizing speeches on issue of race delivered at Republican National Convention, fearing such talk will further alienate minorities from party; speeches, among them talks emphasizing rule of law and denigrating Black Lives Matter movement, are delivered by black and white speakers to largely white audience; 2016 convention has fewer black delegates and speakers than any in two decades.

headline.main: Black Republicans See a White Convention, Heavy on Lectures
headline.print_headline: Convention Speeches Unsettle Blacks in G.O.P.

byline.original: By PATRICK HEALY, YAMICHE ALCINDOR and JEREMY W. PETERS

docs.snippet: The Latest on the Republican National Convention (all times EDT):...

docs.snippet: Undercutting calls for Republican unity, Texas Sen. Ted Cruz stubbornly refused to endorse Donald Trump Wednesday night as he addressed the GOP convention, igniting thunderous boos from furious delegates as he encouraged Americans to simply "vote ...
docs.lead_paragraph: Undercutting calls for Republican unity, Texas Sen. Ted Cruz stubbornly refused to endorse Donald Trump Wednesday night as he addressed the GOP convention, igniting thunderous boos from furious delegates as he encouraged Americans to simply "vote your conscience" in November.

headline.main: Thunderous Boos for Cruz for Refusing to Endorse Trump
headline.print_headline: Thunderous Boos for Cruz for Refusing to Endorse Trump

docs.snippet: If he wins the presidency, Republican presidential nominee Donald Trump would seek to purge the federal government of officials appointed by Democratic President Barack Obama and could ask Congress to pass legislation making it easier to fire publ...
docs.lead_paragraph: If he wins the presidency, Republican presidential nominee Donald Trump would seek to purge the federal government of officials appointed by Democratic President Barack Obama and could ask Congress to pass legislation making it easier to fire public workers, Trump ally, Chris Christie, said on Tuesday.

headline.main: Exclusive: Trump Could Seek New Law to Purge Government of Obama Appointees
headline.print_headline: Exclusive: Trump Could Seek New Law to Purge Government of Obama Appointees

docs.snippet: A few blocks from the arena hosting the Republican convention, in a 10-acre downtown commons, a full-throated national conversation is taking place....
docs.lead_paragraph: A few blocks from the arena hosting the Republican convention, in a 10-acre downtown commons, a full-throated national conversation is taking place.
docs.abstract: Dan Barry This Land column comments on public discourse held at Cleveland's 10-acre Public Square, where protesters, counter-protesters, visiting delegates and locals gather during Republican National Convention.

headline.main: In Cleveland’s Public Square, Rights Are Exercised. Loudly.
headline.print_headline: In a Public Square, Rights Are Exercised. Vigorously.

docs.snippet: Republican presidential candidate Donald Trump is considering nominating Oklahoma oil and gas mogul Harold Hamm as energy secretary if elected to the White House on Nov. 8, according to four sources close to Trump's campaign....
docs.lead_paragraph: Republican presidential candidate Donald Trump is considering nominating Oklahoma oil and gas mogul Harold Hamm as energy secretary if elected to the White House on Nov. 8, according to four sources close to Trump's campaign.
